definition[0]: a long metal or wooden stick that is put through pieces of meat to hold them together while they are cooked
definition[1]: to make a hole through a piece of food, an object etc with a skewer or with some other pointed object
definition[2]: to criticize someone very strongly, often in a way that other people find humorous
example[0]: Du Bois skewered Washington’s policies in his book, ‘The Souls of Black Folks’.
